description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
name of the participant
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
sex of the participant
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the ape participants - usually numerical
nth time in which this subset pair was presented within session
unique two-item subset from a limited list of ten configurations. Each subset is presented three times per session for a total of 30 subset trials
early item presented within a subset trial (earlier item in the implied list- e.g. 2 is earlier than 4)
late (second) item presented within a subset trial (later item in the implied list- e.g. 4 is later than 2)
coordinates of the early item presented on the x axis
coordinates of the early item presented on the y axis
coordinates of the late item presented on the x axis
coordinates of the late item presented on the y axis
position of the smallest of the two subset items in the original five items list from 1 to 5
the difference between the list positions of the two subset items (e.g. 1 versus 4 has a distance of 3)
Accuracy = 1 means that items were cleared in the correct order/ Accuracy = 0 means that items were not cleared in the correct order
amount of time it took to touch the fist item presented on the screen (measured in milliseconds)
number of times that the individual wavered before the first item was touched
number of times that the individual wavered before the first item was touched according to a second coder. This measure is used for reliability
